result.execSummary:
The defendant Quentin R. McGuire was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Quentin R. McGuire is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Quentin R. McGuire was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Quentin R. McGuire was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Obtain and maintain full time employment

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Quentin R. McGuire

records.addlTxt:
11:33 AM ADA Fuhr calls cases 22CF44, 22TR199 and states appearances. Defendant Quentin R. McGuire appeared in court. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. ADA Fuhr states an agreement has been reached and recites the agreement on record. Contingent upon the defendant's plea to Ct's 2 and 4 in case 22CF44 the State will move to dismiss Ct's 1 and 3 in case 22CF44 and the sole count in 22TR199. Court questions defendant in regards to counsel. Defendant freely, Voluntarily, and intelligently waives his right to an Attorney. Preliminary Hearing waived by defendant.   Court finds probable cause exists that a crime was committed and binds DE over for trial. Waiver accepted by the Court.  Information filed, acknowledged by parties and reading waived.   Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST to Ct's 2 and 4 in case 22CF44 therefore Ct's 1 and 3 are DISMISSED along with 22TR199.  Court questions DE regarding the plea. DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC. Comments by ADA Fuhr. Comments by Defendant. 
Court Imposes:
22CF44
Ct. 2 - Withheld Sentence
2 Years Probation 
Conditions of Probation:
$268 Court Costs 
$250 DNA + Sample 
Defendant must obtain and maintain full time employment

Ct. 4 - Withheld Sentence 
2 Years Probation 
Conditions of Probation: 
$268 Court Costs
Defendant must obtain and maintain full time employment

Defendant is given 3 days Sentence Credit in the event that probation is revoked

Appeal Rights Given
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.
Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.

10:13 AM Defendant Quentin R. McGuire appeared in court. Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  Notice of right to attorney given to DE.  Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.
Demand for discovery and notice of intent to use DNA

3:30 PM DA calls case and state appearances and possible charges. Defendant appeared via video from Price County Jail. Karl J. Kelz appeared for The State of Wisconsin.  DE next court date is 04/05/2022 at 10 am.  Jail gives DE a notice of right to attorney.  Court questions parties as to bond.  DA states bond recommendation. Bond ordered as requested.
